Although the number of persons registered with the service at any one
time normally does not exceed 200, since the files are constantly changing
as individuals accept new positions and others enter the field from commer¬
cial broadcasting or other areas, as well as from the few institutions which
are beginning to provide training for such people, between 600 and 800
men and women have at one time or another been registered with the NAEB
Placement Service, and have benefited from its operation, as have new
stations, some of which were largely staffed through the Placement Service,
Persons placed by the service range from new college graduates
seeking positions as production assistants to those in responsible admin¬
istrative positions, including station managers* Perhaps the greatest
demand is for technical personnel, one area in which the supply has not
been able to keep up with the demand* Several inquiries are received
each day by the Placement Service and many of the requests are urgent
enough to occasion telegrams and long-distance telephone calls, as is
common in such agencies*
The NAEB has felt that this is such an important service that it has
been continued, although on a limited basis, even though outside support,
in the form of grant funds, has ceased. This service is still offered on a
no-fee basis (to both employers and employees) and we are extremely grati¬
